Package common

Interface ICmd2ModelAdapter

  • public interface ICmd2ModelAdapter
    This is the adapter that must be set by the well-known InstallNewCommandCmd to enable some incoming ICmdData to communicate with the local system of the receiver. It is up to the user of this interface to define how much access to the "local system" the command has.
    Author:
    David Senter, Joel Webb

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      void addComponentFactory​(java.util.function.Supplier<java.awt.Component> compFac)
      This method ensures that the new command has a way to display its output on the local system.
      void displayTextMsg​(java.lang.String msg, java.lang.String identifier)
      This method ensures that the new command has a way to display a text message on the local UI.
      java.lang.String getLocalGroupName()
      Retrieves the name of the current room/group that the IMember is in.

    • Method Detail

      • addComponentFactory

        void addComponentFactory​(java.util.function.Supplier<java.awt.Component> compFac)
        This method ensures that the new command has a way to display its output on the local system.
        Parameters:
        compFac - - The component factory that commands passes to the local system, to be displayed however the local system chooses.

      • displayTextMsg

        void displayTextMsg​(java.lang.String msg,
                    java.lang.String identifier)
        This method ensures that the new command has a way to display a text message on the local UI. Output is expected to be on the same component as the text from an ITxtData message would appear.
        Parameters:
        msg - Text message to display
        identifier - Indicates what process is generating the text (e.g. sender name)

      • getLocalMemberName

        java.lang.String getLocalMemberName()
        Gets the name of the local IMember. Returns the same value that the IMember.getName() returns for the local IMember RMI server object.
        Returns:
        The username of this IMember.

      • getLocalGroupName

        java.lang.String getLocalGroupName()
        Retrieves the name of the current room/group that the IMember is in. Returns the same value that the IGroup.getName() returns for that group object.
        Returns:
        The group name of this IMember's associated group.

      • sendMessageToMember

        void sendMessageToMember​(IDataPacketData msg,
                         IMember member)
        Sends the message to the specified member. This method must be non-blocking, i.e. the sending of the message must take place on a different thread than the calling thread.
        Parameters:
        msg - to be sent
        member - to be sent to

      • sendMessageToGroup

        void sendMessageToGroup​(IDataPacketData msg)
        Sends the message to the entire group that this member is in.
        Parameters:
        msg - to be sent

      • getMDDData

        <T> T getMDDData​(MixedDataKey<T> key)
        Gets the value from the mixed data dictionary. If the key doesn't exist in the MDD, then this method should return null. We mandate that there is one MDD per application. Contains method-level generics to ensure consistent typing for the method itself.
        Type Parameters:
        T - Type parameter for the key.
        Parameters:
        key - the class of the data.
        Returns:
        The value indexed by the key in the mixed data dictionary. Return null if the key doesn't exist

      • putMDDData

        <T> void putMDDData​(MixedDataKey<T> key,
                    T value)
        Puts a data into the mixed data dictionary. We mandate that there is one MDD per application. Contains method-level generics to ensure consistent typing for the method itself.
        Type Parameters:
        T - Type parameter for the key.
        Parameters:
        key - The type of the data
        value - The datapacket.
